title: 1983 K League
text:
The 1983 Korean Super League was the first ever season of the <a href="K%20League">K League</a>, the top <a href="association%20football">football</a> league in <a href="South%20Korea">South Korea</a>. A total of five teams participated in the league. Two of them were professional teams (<a href="Hallelujah%20FC">Hallelujah FC</a> and <a href="Jeju%20United%20FC">Yukong Elephants</a>), and three of them were semi-professional teams (<a href="Pohang%20Steelers">POSCO Dolphins</a>, <a href="Busan%20IPark">Daewoo Royals</a> and <a href="Kookmin%20Bank%20FC">Kookmin Bank</a>). Each founding member had its mascot: eagle, elephant, dolphin, royal (crown) and magpie.
The season began on 8 May and ended on 25 September. It was played in two stages: the first stage was held in five cities (<a href="Seoul">Seoul</a>, <a href="Busan">Busan</a>, <a href="Daegu">Daegu</a>, <a href="Jeonju">Jeonju</a>, and <a href="Daejeon">Daejeon</a>), and the second stage was held in nine cities (including <a href="Gwangju">Gwangju</a>, <a href="Chuncheon">Chuncheon</a>, <a href="Masan">Masan</a>, and <a href="Andong">Andong</a>).
